types.name: Python
types.description: Built-in types of Python programming language

type.name: object
type.description: Objects are Python’s abstraction for data. All data in a Python program is represented by objects or by relations between objects.

type.name: None
type.description: This type has a single value. There is a single object with this value. It is used to signify the absence of a value in many situations, e.g., it is returned from functions that don’t explicitly return anything. Its truth value is false.

type.name: NotImplemented
type.description: This type has a single value. There is a single object with this value. Numeric methods and rich comparison methods may return this value if they do not implement the operation for the operands provided.

type.name: Ellipsis
type.description: This type has a single value. There is a single object with this value. It is used to indicate the presence of the ... syntax in a slice.

type.name: bool
type.description: Boolean type. These represent the truth values False and True.

type.name: int
type.description: Plain integers. These represent numbers in the range -2147483648 through 2147483647.

type.name: float
type.description: Floating point numbers. These represent machine-level double precision floating point numbers.

type.name: long
type.description: Long integers. These represent numbers in an unlimited range, subject to available (virtual) memory only.

type.name: complex
type.description: Complex numbers. These represent complex numbers as a pair of machine-level double precision floating point numbers.

type.name: str
type.description: ASCII strings. The items of a string are characters. There is no separate character type; a character is represented by a string of one item.

type.name: unicode
type.description: Unicode strings. These represented by a Unicode object of one item and can hold either a 16-bit or 32-bit value representing a Unicode ordinal.

type.name: list
type.description: The items of a list are arbitrary Python objects. Lists are formed by placing a comma-separated list of expressions in square brackets.

type.name: tuple
type.description: The items of a tuple are arbitrary Python objects. Tuples of two or more items are formed by comma-separated lists of expressions.

type.name: bytearray
type.description: A bytearray object is a mutable array.

type.name: buffer
type.description: The buffer object will be a slice from the beginning of object.

type.name: xrange
type.description: The xrange type is an immutable sequence which is commonly used for looping.

type.name: set
type.description: A set object is an unordered mutable collection of distinct hashable objects.

type.name: frozenset
type.description: A frozenset object is an unordered imutable collection of distinct hashable objects.

type.name: dict
type.description: A mapping object maps hashable values to arbitrary objects. These represent finite sets of objects indexed by nearly arbitrary values.

type.name: file
type.description: A file object represents an open file.
